00010 /**
00011  * Gets current configuration of the @a ifname using WAPI accessors and prints
00012  * them in a pretty fashion with their corresponding return values.
00013  */
00014 static void
00015 get(int sock, const char *ifname)
00016 {
00017     int ret;
00018     double freq;
00019     wapi_freq_flag_t freq_flag;
00020     char essid[WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1];
00021     wapi_essid_flag_t essid_flag;
00022     wapi_mode_t mode;
00023     struct sockaddr ap;
00024     struct ether_addr *ap_addr;
00025     int bitrate;
00026     wapi_bitrate_flag_t bitrate_flag;
00027     int txpower;
00028     wapi_txpower_flag_t txpower_flag;
00029 
00030     /* freq */
00031     ret = wapi_get_freq(sock, ifname, &freq, &freq_flag);
00032     printf("wapi_get_freq(): ret: %d", ret);
00033     if (ret >= 0)
00034         printf(", freq: %g, freq_flag: %s", freq, wapi_freq_flags[freq_flag]);
00035     putchar('\n');
00036 
00037     /* essid */
00038     ret = wapi_get_essid(sock, ifname, essid, &essid_flag);
00039     printf("wapi_get_essid(): ret: %d", ret);
00040     if (ret >= 0)
00041         printf(
00042             ", essid: %s, essid_flag: %s",
00043             essid, wapi_essid_flags[essid_flag]);
00044     putchar('\n');
00045 
00046     /* operating mode */
00047     ret = wapi_get_mode(sock, ifname, &mode);
00048     printf("wapi_get_mode(): ret: %d", ret);
00049     if (ret >= 0)
00050         printf(", mode: %s", wapi_modes[mode]);
00051     putchar('\n');
00052 
00053     /* ap */
00054     ret = wapi_get_ap(sock, ifname, &ap);
00055     ap_addr = (struct ether_addr *) &ap.sa_data;
00056     printf("wapi_get_ap(): ret: %d", ret);
00057     if (ret >= 0)
00058         printf(
00059             ", ap: %02X:%02X:%02X:%02X:%02X:%02X",
00060             ap_addr->ether_addr_octet[0],
00061             ap_addr->ether_addr_octet[1],
00062             ap_addr->ether_addr_octet[2],
00063             ap_addr->ether_addr_octet[3],
00064             ap_addr->ether_addr_octet[4],
00065             ap_addr->ether_addr_octet[5]);
00066     putchar('\n');
00067 
00068     /* bitrate */
00069     ret = wapi_get_bitrate(sock, ifname, &bitrate, &bitrate_flag);
00070     printf("wapi_get_bitrate(): ret: %d", ret);
00071     if (ret >= 0)
00072         printf(
00073             ", bitrate: %d, bitrate_flag: %s", bitrate,
00074             wapi_bitrate_flags[bitrate_flag]);
00075     putchar('\n');
00076 
00077     /* txpower */
00078     ret = wapi_get_txpower(sock, ifname, &txpower, &txpower_flag);
00079     printf("wapi_get_txpower(): ret: %d", ret);
00080     if (ret >= 0)
00081         printf(
00082             ", txpower: %d, txpower_flag: %s",
00083             txpower, wapi_txpower_flags[txpower_flag]);
00084     putchar('\n');
00085 }

00088 /**
00089  * Tries to alter configuration parameters of supplied @a ifname interface. Pay
00090  * attention that, setters require root privileges. Moreover, a majority of the
00091  * commodity wireless drivers provide access to alter only a particular subset
00092  * of the available configurations.
00093  */
00094 static void __attribute__((unused))
00095 set(int sock, const char *ifname)
00096 {
00097     int ret;
00098     struct sockaddr ap;
00099 
00100     /* freq */
00101     ret = wapi_set_freq(sock, ifname, 2.462e09, WAPI_FREQ_FIXED);
00102     printf("wapi_set_freq(): ret: %d\n", ret);
00103 
00104     /* essid */
00105     ret = wapi_set_essid(sock, ifname, "moo", WAPI_ESSID_ON);
00106     printf("wapi_set_essid(): ret: %d\n", ret);
00107 
00108     /* mode */
00109     ret = wapi_set_mode(sock, ifname, WAPI_MODE_MANAGED);
00110     printf("wapi_set_mode(): ret: %d\n", ret);
00111 
00112     /* ap */
00113     wapi_make_broad_ether(&ap);
00114     ret = wapi_set_ap(sock, ifname, &ap);
00115     printf("wapi_set_ap(): ret: %d\n", ret);
00116 
00117     /* bitrate */
00118     ret = wapi_set_bitrate(sock, ifname, -1, WAPI_BITRATE_AUTO);
00119     printf("wapi_set_bitrate(): ret: %d\n", ret);
00120 
00121     /* txpower */
00122     ret = wapi_set_txpower(sock, ifname, 20, WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM);
00123     printf("wapi_set_txpower(): ret: %d\n", ret);
00124 }

00127 /**
00128  * Scans available APs in the range using given @a ifname interface. (Requires
00129  * root privileges to start a scan.)
00130  */
00131 static void
00132 scan(int sock, const char *ifname)
00133 {
00134     int sleepdur = 1;
00135     int sleeptries = 5;
00136     wapi_list_t list;
00137     wapi_scan_info_t *info;
00138     int ret;
00139 
00140     /* start scan */
00141     ret = wapi_scan_init(sock, ifname);
00142     printf("wapi_scan_init(): ret: %d\n", ret);
00143 
00144     /* wait for completion */
00145     do {
00146         sleep(sleepdur);
00147         ret = wapi_scan_stat(sock, ifname);
00148         printf("wapi_scan_stat(): ret: %d, sleeptries: %d\n", ret, sleeptries);
00149     } while (--sleeptries > 0 && ret > 0);
00150     if (ret < 0) return;
00151 
00152     /* collect results */
00153     bzero(&list, sizeof(wapi_list_t));
00154     ret = wapi_scan_coll(sock, ifname, &list);
00155     printf("wapi_scan_coll(): ret: %d\n", ret);
00156 
00157     /* print found aps */
00158     for (info = list.head.scan; info; info = info->next)
00159         printf(">> @%xl%s\n", (size_t) info, (info->has_essid ? info->essid : ""));
00160 }
00161 
00162 
00163 int
00164 main(void)
00165 {
00166     wapi_list_t names;
00167     int ret;
00168     int sock;
00169 
00170     bzero(&names, sizeof(wapi_list_t));
00171     ret = wapi_get_ifnames(&names);
00172     printf("wapi_get_ifnames(): ret: %d", ret);
00173     if (ret >= 0)
00174     {
00175         wapi_string_t *str;
00176 
00177         printf(", ifnames:");
00178         for (str = names.head.string; str; str = str->next)
00179             printf(" %s", str->data);
00180     }
00181     putchar('\n');
00182 
00183     sock = wapi_make_socket();
00184     printf("wapi_make_socket(): sock: %d\n", sock);
00185 
00186     printf("\ninitial conf\n");
00187     printf("------------\n");
00188     get(sock, "wlan0");
00189 
00190 #ifdef ENABLE_SET
00191     printf("\nchanging conf...\n");
00192     set(sock, "wlan0");
00193 
00194     printf("\nfinal conf\n");
00195     printf("----------\n");
00196     get(sock, "wlan0");
00197 #endif
00198 
00199     printf("\nscan\n");
00200     printf("----\n");
00201     scan(sock, "wlan0");
00202 
00203     return 0;
00204 }
